titlestmt.titleproper: A Finding Aid to the William J. Eisenlord Photographs, 1953-1976, in the Archives of American Art
titlestmt.author: Margaret J. Hughes
titlestmt.sponsor: Funding for the digitization of this collection was provided by the Terra Foundation for American Art

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-09-14 14:02:24 -0400.

did.unittitle: William J. Eisenlord photographs
did.abstract: The photographs of San Francisco photographer William J. Eisenlord measure 0.3 linear feet and date from 1953-1976. Photographs depict the City Lights Bookstore of San Francisco, California and the exhibition opening of "Poets of the Cities" at the San Francisco Museum of Art in 1976. Also included are photographs of jazz and beat poetry performances taken by Ed Nyberg in 1957.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: The William J. Eisenlord photographs were donated to the Archives of American Art in two installments, in 1976 and 1977, by William J. Eisenlord.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies note
altformavail.p: The collection was digitized in 2011 and is available via the Archives of American Art's website.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: The collection was microfilmed upon receipt on reel 3957. It was fully processed and described by Margaret J. Hughes in 2010 and digitized in 2011 with funding provided by the Terra Foundation for American Art.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: William J. Eisenlord photographs, 1953-1976. Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Use of original papers requires an appointment.

userestrict.head: Terms of Use
userestrict.p: The Archives of American Art makes its archival collections available for non-commercial, educational and personal use unless restricted by copyright and/or donor restrictions, including but not limited to access and publication restrictions. AAA makes no representations concerning such rights and restrictions and it is the user's responsibility to determine whether rights or restrictions exist and to obtain any necessary permission to access, use, reproduce and publish the collections. Please refer to the Smithsonian's Terms of Use for additional information.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: William J. Eisenlord (1926-1997) worked as a photographer in San Francisco, California. He was an acquaintance of photographer, poet, and journalist Mark Green. Together with business partner Thayne Riggs, Eisenlord opened the Omnibus Gallery in Sacramento, California in 1980.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The photographs of San Francisco photographer William J. Eisenlord measure 0.3 linear feet and date from 1953-1976. Photographs depict the City Lights Bookstore of San Francisco, California and the exhibition opening of "Poets of the Cities" at the San Francisco Museum of Art in 1976. Also included are photographs of jazz and beat poetry performances taken by Ed Nyberg in 1957.

City Lights Bookstore was a popular meeting ground for many people associated with the Beat literary movement in San Francisco. The collection includes one exterior window photograph of the bookstore taken the year of its founding in 1953, and fifteen interior photographs of the store taken circa 1959. The interior shots include images of bookstore founder Lawrence Ferlinghetti, bookstore manager Shigeyoshi Murao, and various customers browsing the stacks.

The photographs taken at the "Poets of the Cities" exhibition opening on January 30, 1976 at the San Francisco Museum of Art include notable figures Jack Micheline, Claes Oldenburg, James Broughton, Phil Linhares, Mark and Sally Green, Michael Larsen, Elizabeth Pomada, Ken deRoux, Peter and Minette LeBlanc, Jack Hirschman, Rolando Castellon, Knute Stiles, Michael and Joanna McClure, Byron Meyer, Peter Selz, Leo Castelli, George Herms, and Shirley and Wallace Berman.

Also included are ten photographs taken in 1957 by Ed Nyberg at The Jazz Cellar, a popular San Francisco beat nightclub. Notable figures include Kenneth Rexroth, Lawrence Ferlinghetti, Grover Sales Jr., Sonny Wayne, and Bill Weisjahn.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged as 2 series:

list.head: Missing Title
list.item: Series 1: William J. Eisenlord Photographs, 1953-1976 (Box 1; 15 folders)

did.unittitle: City Lights Bookstore

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: City Lights Bookstore was a popular meeting ground for many people associated with the Beat literary movement in San Francisco. The collection includes one exterior window photograph of the bookstore taken the year of its founding in 1953, and fifteen interior photographs of the store taken circa 1959. The interior shots include images of bookstore founder Lawrence Ferlinghetti, bookstore manager Shigeyoshi Murao, and various customers browsing the stacks.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: The subseries has been scanned in its entirety.

did.unittitle: Ed Nyberg Photographs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series consists of ten photographs taken in 1957 by Ed Nyberg at The Jazz Cellar, a popular San Francisco beat nightclub. Notable figures include Kenneth Rexroth, Lawrence Ferlinghetti, Grover Sales Jr., Sonny Wayne, and Bill Weisjahn.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: The series has been scanned in its entirety.
